title: @Moderator: ???

replies.body: While i understand you may not have intended it the way it was read, any discussion of blackface, whiteface, brownface, etc. on the boards is going to be inappropriate, as it veers far too close to racism and social issues. A discussion of "which direction is this skin racist?" is not acceptable, and is the line of conversation the removed comment appeared to be opening up.

I do understand the perspective you had when posting, definitely. The content posted, however, was a bit too problematic, even including the smileyface (which doesn't really do much to mitigate the potential issues here). While I personally might have simply removed the comment, I can see why it might receive the lowest tier of ban we give -- and I'm afraid that, since the duration has elapsed, I couldn't reverse it even if I wanted to.

I would recommend avoiding topics like the one you were responding to in general.

No, although that was a concern with that comment specifically. The removal and punishment was for engaging in a racial/social issue thread in a way that added to the racial/social discussion *and secondarily* threw another topic into the mix. It's best to avoid discussions that violate board rules in general and, if you do contribute, avoid jokes or comments related to prohibited topics.

You weren't banned for saying something racist about white people. That's [allowed on Boards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/79Bez555-i-think-racist-rant-threads-should-be-deleted-not-just-locked-because-they-escalated). You were banned because dyeing one's face to the opposite skin tone has historically been done in a direction that's racist against black people, and therefore any discussion of that is racist against black people, which is not allowed on Boards.

I think the mods might be trying to mimic [Jane Elliott's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_Elliott) famous lesson, which is laudable, but they're doing it in a really ham-handed way.
